meanings.definition: Lacking moral discipline or ignoring legal restraint, especially in sexual conduct.
meanings.sent1: The licentious behavior of the unruly teenagers shocked the community.
meanings.sent2: Her licentious actions at the party were frowned upon by the guests.
meanings.sent3: The licentious cat kept sneaking into the neighbor's yard to chase birds.
meanings.sent4: The storm's licentious winds tore through the town, leaving destruction in their wake.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted a licentious character whose actions led to his downfall.

meanings.definition: Marked by disregard for strict rules of correctness.
meanings.sent1: The artist's licentious style challenged traditional norms in the art world.
meanings.sent2: His licentious speech offended many at the formal event.
meanings.sent3: The licentious clock refused to keep accurate time, always running fast or slow.
meanings.sent4: The licentious dance performance pushed boundaries and shocked the audience.
meanings.sent5: The licentious design of the building stood out among the surrounding structures.

meanings.definition: Promiscuous and unprincipled in sexual matters.
meanings.sent1: The gossip magazines often portrayed celebrities as licentious individuals.
meanings.sent2: The novel's protagonist was known for his licentious relationships with multiple partners.
meanings.sent3: The licentious flower garden seemed to bloom with no regard for order or design.
meanings.sent4: The licentious river meandered freely through the countryside, changing its course unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The licentious behavior of the characters added drama to the soap opera storyline.
